10 // Eigen linear algebra library: https://eigen.tuxfamily.org
11 #include "bb_util/Eigen/Eigen"

13 // Definitions for neuron population sizes are included here, do not
14 // override them.
15 #include "cx_model.hpp"
16 
17 // [V]ector[M]emory[C]entralComple[X]
18 // Central complex network capable of storing a single vector memory.
19 // In the context of the beetle this represents multiple celestial
20 // snapshots. Vector Memory architecture taken from Le Moel et al. 2019.
21 class VMCX : public CentralComplex{
22 private:
23  //
24  // The core is brought in from CentralComplex, we just need the
25  // singular vector memory components.
26  //
27  // Weight matrix
28  Eigen::Matrix<double, CX_N_CPU4, 1> W_VM;
29 
30  // Vector memory neuron, basically acts as an on/off
31  // switch. Should be 1 (max rate) when using vector memory,
32  // 0 when not.
33  double VM = 0;
34  double baseline = 0.5;
35 
36 public:
37  VMCX(){
38  this->W_VM.setConstant(0.5);
39  }
40 
41  // Need to be able to store a vector memory
42  void store_vm();
43 
44  // Clearing vector memory, for whatever reason.
45  void clear_vm();
46 
47  // Want to be able to turn the system on or off
48  void activate_vm();
49  void deactivate_vm();
50 
51  // Toggle is more convenient, returns the new state at the end of the
52  // function call
53  bool toggle_vm();
54 
55  // Get the current status of the vm system (on or off)
56  bool vm_status();
57 
58  // Single function for VMCX operation.
59  double unimodal_VMCX(double theta, double speed);
60 
61  //
62  // Overrides
63  //
64 
65  // Override the CPU1 update rule
66  void cpu1_output(Eigen::Ref<Eigen::MatrixXd> tb1,
67  Eigen::Ref<Eigen::MatrixXd> cpu4,
68  Eigen::Ref<Eigen::MatrixXd> cpu1);
69 
70  void get_status(std::vector<std::vector<double>>&);
71 };
72 
73 //
74 // Public
75 //
76 // Question: Should I be using this->MEM here or this->CPU4?
77 // I think CPU4 is correct here but this may be an issue
78 void VMCX::store_vm(){
79  //this->W_VM = -1 * this->CPU4;
80  this->clear_vm(); //reset to 0.5
81  //this->W_VM = -1 * this->CPU4; //-(rCPU4) : Le Moel et al.
82  //this->W_VM = -1 * this->MEM; //-(Icpu4 - 0.5)
83  //this->W_VM = -1 * (this->CPU4 - this->W_VM); //-(rCPU4 - 0.5)
84  this->W_VM = -1 * (this->MEM - this->W_VM); //-(Icpu4 - 0.5)
85  ROS_INFO("VM STORED");
86 }
87 
88 void VMCX::clear_vm(){
89  this->W_VM.setConstant(0.5);
90 }
91 
92 // Turn on, no value check
93 void VMCX::activate_vm(){
94  this->VM = 1;
95  ROS_INFO("VM ACTIVATED");
96 }
97 
98 // Turn off, no value check
99 void VMCX::deactivate_vm(){
100  this->VM = 0;
101  ROS_INFO("VM DEACTIVATED");
102 }
103 
104 // Invert signal
105 bool VMCX::toggle_vm(){
106  this->VM = -1 * (VM - 1);
107  std::string state = this->vm_status() ? "ACTIVATED" : "DEACTIVATED";
108  ROS_INFO("VM %s", state.c_str());
109  return this->vm_status();
110 }
111 
112 // Return boolean conversion of VM activity
113 bool VMCX::vm_status(){ return this->VM == 1 ? true : false; };
114 
115 /* VMCX operation
116  Usage:
117  - To update the CX without using it for steering, ignore the output
118  - To use the CX for homing call VMCX::deactivate_vm() and then use the
119  function return value to steer.
120  - To use the VM component call VMCX::actiate_vm() and then use the
121  return value to steer. Note you need to store a VM first.
122  */
123 double VMCX::unimodal_VMCX(double theta, double speed){
124  double CXMotor = 0;
125 
126  this->tl2_output(theta, this->TL2);
127  this->cl1_output(this->TL2, this->CL1);
128  this->tb1_output(this->CL1, this->TB1);
129  this->cpu4_update(speed, this->TB1, this->MEM);
130 
131  this->CPU4 = this->MEM; // Copy unsigmoided CPU4 state
132  this->cpu4_output(this->CPU4); // Squash
133 
134  this->cpu1_output(this->TB1, this->CPU4, this->CPU1);
135 
136  CXMotor = this->motor_output(this->CPU1);
137 
138  return CXMotor;
139 }
140 
141 //
142 // Overrides
143 //
144 void VMCX::cpu1_output(Eigen::Ref<Eigen::MatrixXd> tb1,
145  Eigen::Ref<Eigen::MatrixXd> cpu4,
146  Eigen::Ref<Eigen::MatrixXd> cpu1){
147  cpu1 =
148  this->W_CPU4_CPU1 * (cpu4 + (this->W_VM * this->VM))
149  - (this->W_TB1_CPU1 * tb1);
150  // Include the VM component
151 
152  this->sigmoid(cpu1, this->cpu1_slope, this->cpu1_bias, this->noise);
153 }
154 
155 // Will need to override CPU1 update rule but wait out to get the rest
156 // working first
157 
158 
159 //
160 // Format and output VMCX internal status for the
161 //
162 void VMCX::get_status(std::vector<std::vector<double>> &activity){
163  std::vector<double> tl2_vec(this->TL2.data(),
164  this->TL2.data() +
165  this->TL2.rows() * this->TL2.cols()
166  );
167  std::vector<double> cl1_vec(this->CL1.data(),
168  this->CL1.data() +
169  this->CL1.rows() * this->CL1.cols()
170  );
171  std::vector<double> tb1_vec(this->TB1.data(),
172  this->TB1.data() +
173  this->TB1.rows() * this->TB1.cols()
174  );
175  std::vector<double> cpu4_vec(this->CPU4.data(),
176  this->CPU4.data() +
177  this->CPU4.rows() * this->CPU4.cols()
178  );
179  std::vector<double> mem_vec(this->MEM.data(),
180  this->MEM.data() +
181  this->MEM.rows() * this->MEM.cols()
182  );
183  std::vector<double> cpu1_vec(this->CPU1.data(),
184  this->CPU1.data() +
185  this->CPU1.rows() * this->CPU1.cols()
186  );
187  std::vector<double> vm_vec(this->W_VM.data(),
188  this->W_VM.data() +
189  this->W_VM.rows() * this->W_VM.cols()
190  );
191 
192  Eigen::Matrix<double, 1, 16> active_mat =
193  this->W_CPU4_CPU1 * (this->CPU4 +(this->VM * this->W_VM));
194 
195  std::vector<double> active_vm(active_mat.data(),
196  active_mat.data() +
197  active_mat.rows() * active_mat.cols()
198  );
199 
200  for (int i = 0; i < active_vm.size(); i++){
201  ROS_INFO("%f\n", active_vm[i]);
202  }
203 
204  activity.push_back(tl2_vec);
205  activity.push_back(cl1_vec);
206  activity.push_back(tb1_vec);
207  activity.push_back(cpu4_vec);
208  activity.push_back(mem_vec);
209  activity.push_back(cpu1_vec);
210  activity.push_back(vm_vec);
211  activity.push_back(active_vm);
212 }
